data.title: Relaxing, restful place
data.text: We used Suki Cafe as an early dinner reward after a full day of errands with the family.  A nice, relaxing reward.  We ordered a nice assortment of sushi/sashimi and edamame, noodles and soup.  Everything was good, with a tasteful flair.   The dining room was beautifully decorated and we were never rushed. It was delightful!

data.title: Pretty good food, but service super slow.
data.text: I looked this restaurant up and it was given 5 stars.   I guess you can't believe everything you read.  We got there on a Sunday night, with only a couple of tables with people.  At first the hostess wanted to sit us at the door, I said no.  She seated us at the other end, which was much better.  We ordered fresh rolls and they were not very good.  Being a vegetarian,  sometimes I find it difficult to order a good meal.  I finally found something and it was pretty good,  not 5 stars though.  Once we were done, we waited for a long time to get our check.  I finally walked up to the owner in the far corner, he yelled out something and we finally got someone to help us  out.  We probably wouldn't return here again if we travel to Great Falls again.

data.title: Pleasant atmosphere and decent food
data.text: Pretty good Thai food (did not try the sushi this visit but I noticed they have a good selection).  Very pleasant server.  Pleasant atmosphere. We enjoyed our meals.  My portion of duck was so generous the two of us enjoyed the leftovers for lunch the next day. Hit the spot while traveling. I would return.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Atmosphere and food is top of the line, parking lot could be better, but you can't have everything. Still nice experience.

data.title: Great Food, Plenty of Variety!
data.text:
If you're looking for delicious Asian cuisine, definitely go to this place!  There is quite a bit of variety on the menu, and the menu items cater to various dietary needs (vegetarian/vegan, etc.).  Their Pad Thai is absolutely fantastic!  My husband enjoys their sushi.  Also try the plum wine...very sweet and fruity!

However, don't expect the customer service we're used to in the United States; the restaurant owner and employees are from Asia, and treat their jobs as such.  Namely, the servers are down-to-business and sometimes come off as terse or rude.  Don't take it personally; it's a cultural thing.

data.title: Wow things have gone DOWN HILL
data.text:
I have reviewed this place on here before, and have always given them high volumes of praise and positive word of mouth. I will NEVER go there again and suggest anyone with dietary restrictions to avoid the disaster we went through. We actually reviewed them on Facebook and what a surprise - they removed it! 
We asked the waitress if they could roll the sushi without seaweed due to dietary restrictions. She said no problem at all. Well the guy rolling the sushi started throwing a fit about it acting like we didn't know what we were talking about so they sent this young "manager" kid out to tell us there is no way to roll sushi without seaweed. We told him we have had other sushi restaurants do it for us and he started getting irritated and telling us that we can't order off someone elses menu. We asked if we could just get more Nagiri instead of the Sushi and he said that would be fine. We also requested our entire order with no sesame seeds on it due to dietary restrictions. When our order came it has sesame seeds - no big deal - we just needed that set changed to what we ordered. We started to ask the waitress when she excused herself to grab the young "manager" because she did not understand what we were asking. He comes out and asks what was going on and before he can even finish talking the guy rolling the sushi started yelling through the restaurant saying that he refuses to remake it and if that's what we wanted then we could just leave. My husband got up and went to the counter to talk to the guy and asked him why he would yell like that across the restaurant. Him and the manager became very threatening putting their fingers in my husbands face telling us to leave and yelling at us saying we were ordering from a different restaurants menu. I told them they had no right being in business if they can not comply to a simply request that could KILL someone. No freakin joke just one of those stupid seeds could kill my husband!
We ask these questions up front before we place an order so that we do not have issues like this. They should never have said yes if they could handle them or fixing it when they make a mistake. We have been going to Suki Café since they opened and I am so extremely disappointed and embarrassed to have been treated how we were and that we have places in our city that treat people like this.
We were not unreasonable nor were we rude or demanding. They will never see another dollar from us EVER. This happened on April 24th, 2016.

data.title: Variety
data.text: Suki Cafe has a little bit of everything.  Hubbie can get sushi, I can get duck.  The staff is friendly, lightening fast, and the place is immaculate.

data.title: Memories of Visiting Japan,Wonderful!
data.text:
My husband took me to Suki Cafe for my Mother's Day dinner. The restaurant is beautiful. The atmosphere is very calming and enjoyable. The service is excellent and our server was very nice, polite and always had a smile when she checked on us. The Shrimp Tempura reminded us of our visit to Japan in 1985. The meal was well presented, beautiful and tasted so good!
I had some hot Sake. I love it, but it goes to my head if I drink too much. It's a very potent wine. I also had some hot green tea to try and halt the effect of the Sake some.
We had a wonderful dinner, enjoyed each others company immensely and had a very nice time together.
We look forward to going back soon and trying their Tempura Fried Ice Cream! Unfortunately, they were out when we asked about having some after dinner.
If you enjoy oriental food and want a change of pace from the typical Chinese food, Suki Cafe is a great place to try something new. And if you aren't sure if you'd like Japanese food, they have a steak restaurant on the other side of the Japanese restaurant, so the best of both worlds! Try and Enjoy!

data.title: Customer service hell.
data.text:
2 stars, a number I absolutely do not like giving. Especially for a restaurant I have truly enjoyed in the past. 
 My husband and I have enjoyed Suki for years. I and have met friends for lunch, brought clients for lunch dates, spent our anniversaries there, brought our kids and family. We LOVED it. That is until a friend and I went for lunch one day. 
 If you check out my reviews, you'll see, I spend time in the Northwest, I'm no stranger to shellfish of any kind and I know what it should smell and taste like. This visit I ordered steamed mussels as an app, we always try a new app when we come to keep diverse. These smelled wrong, the taste followed suite they tasted bad. When I called the waitress to let her know (heaven forbid many people order these and become sick.) She instantly became mad, and told me it's because I did not know what Mussels tasted like. No offer of exchange or refund or even a simple apology. Just blame the customer. After that service became very slow, and what little that did happen was awkward and uncomfortable. Needless to say, we asked for our check to leave. When my money was returned I was shorted 2.00. Which I took from the tip. After years of visiting this place, I will not return. If Suki thinks their customer problem is their marketing, they need to look a little closer to home at their customer service. All the marketing in the world can't cover up that mess.

data.title: Sushi was very good,  but...
data.text: The Tai was killer.  Really enjoyed the Tom Yum seafood soup.  Light and flavorful.   A must.   Curry Masaman was delicious.

data.title: Very very nice local sushi
data.text: Had a blast here. Family owned, they are very kind.....the sushi was really excellent and served with personal touches that made it all the better. The green tea was served at an excellent temperature and it was great as well. I recommend the spider roll and any of the spicy tuna rolls, although the sashimi dinners are incredible.

data.title: Great Little Local Place!
data.text: This place has great service and the food is tasty and done right.  The family that owns this place is really kind and hospitable. They have green tea ice cream and red bean ice cream and I have ordered both in a big container to go and they were very accommodating. Their sushi is very nice and I think the best in Great Falls.

data.title: Only place for Sushi in GF
data.text:
Excellent staff.  Food good with reasonable prices.  When it comes to Sushi here in GF, there is no other option.  

Period!!!

data.title: Rude staff!
data.text: Their sign said they opened at noon, waiting outside untill 12:20.  Hostess told us to seat ourselves, ok then...When we were ready to order we had to find someone to take the order.  I ordered a pepsi and it came out flat.  I then had to go back up to the counter to ask for another.  The chef then stormed off and 5 minutes later the hostess just walked by and slammed a glass of water on the table and walked away.  Only 1 party of 2 came in after us and we were not checked in on at all.  I had to go ask for the check and to-go containers.  As for the food, sushi was sub-par and the food we had cooked to order was marginal.  Will not be going back again!

data.title: Food so so but service so RUDE !
data.text: Suki Cafe ! Not good experience for me ! When I came there have two boys working behind bar. They told me to setting down waiting for the services and a older lady came to me and bring me the menu and gone . Later about 5 mins she come back and  impatient .....and so RUDE do to me ! I believe the owner doesn't know what going on there!

data.title: Tas
data.text:
I love sushi
best roll in my mind
firer cracker roll,
golden spicy roll,
dragon roll,
red dragon roll,
suki cafe roll,
and etc.

fast and good food in town.

data.title: Top of a very small market.
data.text:
If this were in another town it would get a three, but given the complete lack of other Thai places, it is not a bad choice.  I have had several dishes here, the Pad Thai, which I found to be rather bland, and several very good stir frys and currys. 

The staff is good and wait times are short, value is iffy, but again, its the only place in town for Thai that I've found.

data.title: Must go to for sushi
data.text: Lots of great specialty rolls to choose from.  Tried the mermaid roll which was delicious.  It is a go to for my friend who lives in the area.

data.title: Got my Thai curry fix!
data.text:
My office went for our usual weekly luncheon outings. I had the red Thai curry with beef; it was perfectly spiced.

Not a big fan of their sushi but the Thai dishes are good. Service was quick too.

data.title: Still a Great Little Place to Sushi Up
data.text: Every now and again ya just gotta have some sushi and miso. Throw in some warm saki and you've got an enjoyable meal. Service is always excellent. The variety is always there. Food delivery to the table is always prompt and accurate. You definitely need to pass through once or twice at least.
